Key Match Events: Konate scored an early goal for Burkina Faso in the 5th minute.
Ntibazonkiza scored for Burundi in the 53rd minute.
Traore scored a penalty for Burkina Faso in the 90+4th minute.
Kabore received a yellow card in the 85th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Burundi are participating in their 11th AFCON qualification campaign but have only made it to the main draw once, in 2019.
Burundi started their qualification campaign with a win against Malawi but lost to Senegal in their next match.
Burkina Faso have been a regular feature at the Africa Cup of Nations over the past decade, reaching the round of 16 in the tournament hosted by Ivory Coast earlier this year.
Burkina Faso currently leads their group with seven points and a +5 goal difference.
Since taking up the head coaching role in March, Brama Traore has overseen five competitive matches, losing only one.
Post-Match Reflections: Etienne Ndayiragije took a few positives from the match despite the loss, noting that his side managed to register more shots at goal than their opponents with just 40% possession.
Burundi have now lost all three matches they have ever played against Burkina Faso, conceding nine goals and scoring only twice.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Stade de l'Amitie due to stadiums in both nations failing to meet FIFA standards for international competition.
Burkina Faso have scored in every match since Brama Traore's arrival, with eight goals in the competition to date, the second-most of any participating nation.
